title: Database Management
schemaHelp: Select the PostgreSQL schema to request access to
schemaErrorHelp: Using default schemas as an alternative. You can select "public" or another common schema
publicSchemaInfo: The "public" schema is the default schema in PostgreSQL. All tables will be created in this schema unless specified otherwise.
informationSchemaWarning: The "information_schema" contains database metadata. This is a system schema and usually requires administrative permissions.
pgCatalogWarning: The "pg_catalog" schema contains system tables and functions. This is a system schema and usually requires administrative permissions.

connectionMessages.connection_error_missing_credentials: Error: Incomplete credentials. Please fill out all required fields.
connectionMessages.connection_error_failed_to_connect: Connection error: Failed to connect to server
connectionMessages.connection_error_refused: Connection error: Connection refused. The server actively refused the connection.
connectionMessages.connection_error_no_route: Connection error: No route to host. Check if the host is reachable.
connectionMessages.connection_error_timeout: Connection error: Connection timed out. The server took too long to respond.
connectionMessages.connection_error_invalid_credentials: Error: Invalid credentials. Please check username and password.
connectionMessages.connection_error_database_not_exist: Error: The specified database does not exist.
connectionMessages.connection_error_user_not_exist: Error: The specified user does not exist.
connectionMessages.connection_error_permission_denied: Error: Permission denied. The user lacks necessary permissions.
connectionMessages.connection_error_query_failed: Error: Query execution failed. The server couldn't run the test query.
connectionMessages.connection_error_query_timeout: Error: Query timed out. The test query took too long to execute.
connectionMessages.connection_error_query_syntax: Error: Syntax error in test query.
connectionMessages.connection_error_service_failure: Error: Internal service failure while testing connection.
connectionMessages.connection_success_but_privilege_check_f: Connection established successfully, but could not verify administrative privileges.
connectionMessages.connection_success_no_admin_privileges: Connection established successfully, but the user DOES NOT have the necessary administrative privileges.
connectionMessages.connection_success_with_admin_privileges: Connection established successfully. The user has the necessary administrative privileges.

form.name: Name
form.nameHelp: A friendly name to identify this database
form.nameTooltip: A descriptive name that will help you identify this database connection
form.typeTooltip: The database engine type. This will determine the connection settings and port
form.descriptionHelp: Optional description for this database connection
form.hostHelp: IP address or hostname of your database server
form.hostTooltip: The hostname or IP address where your database server is running (e.g. 192.168.1.10 or db.example.com)
form.databaseHelp: Optional: specific database to connect to. If empty, all schemas will be available
form.databaseTooltip: Leave this field empty to scan for all available databases/schemas on the server. Useful for MySQL installations with multiple databases

deleteConfirmation.title: Delete Database
deleteConfirmation.message: Are you sure you want to delete this database? All associated permissions and access requests will also be deleted. This action cannot be undone.

syncDescription: Configure synchronization options for this database
